sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"学期"之意。
means: term和semester作"学期"解时，其主要差别在于使用地区的不同。term多用于英国，semester主要在美国、德国使用。

sentence.Network_cn: 我这学期打算学习应用数学课程.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from German Semester, from Latin semestris 'six-monthly', from sex 'six' + mensis 'month'

entry.tran: (某些国家中学院及大学的)学期,半学年
entry.def: In colleges and universities in some countries, a semester is one of the two main periods into which the year is divided.

means.word_mean: 1. one of two divisions of an academic year
2. half a year; a period of 6 months

Sentence.sentence: They're also expensive, especially when you factor in the average college student's limited budget, typically costing hundreds of dollars every semester.
The biggest problem with traditional print textbooks is that they cost hundreds of dollars every semester.
they cost hundreds of dollars every semester.
One of five students arrives at college today with Advanced Placement (AP) credits amounting to a semester or more of college level work.
